articles.description: Brehanna Daniels and Breanna O’Leary, both talented college athletes, knew little about the sport before they were recruited through NASCAR’s Drive for Diversity program. Not only are the pair the first female duo to pit for the same team in NASCAR’s top seri…

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: As more states legalize, some couples inspired to incorporate weed into weddings
articles.description: With recreational use of marijuana allowed in ten states, some aficionados have decided to incorporate weed into their wedding ceremonies — combining the lucrative wedding industry with the growing legal weed business.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Olympian Rowdy Gaines warns others after scammers pretended to hold his daughter hostage
articles.description: The three-time gold medalist received a call demanding money claiming his daughter Madison was kidnapped, but it was all a trick. The scammers also had Madison on the phone thousands of miles away and used technology to dupe the family.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: After Florida voted to ban dog racing, what’s next for the greyhounds?
articles.description: Greyhound racing has been voted out in Florida, home to 11 of the country’s 17 tracks. Thousands of greyhounds could need homes as the sport is phased out in the state, with groups now hoping to help resettle the dogs.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Argentine submarine found one year after disappearing with 44 aboard
articles.description: The naval submarine vanished last year in the South Atlantic, triggering an intense search by 18 countries. The imploded wreckage was found more than 2,600 feet underwater.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Estimated one million Uighur Muslims vanish into Chinese ‘re-education’ camps
articles.description: China only recently admitted that these so called “re-education” camps existed, where former detainees tell NBC News that they were punished for speaking and forced into restraints.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: First group of Central American migrants arrives in Tijuana to seek asylum in U.S.
articles.description: Roughly 3,000 migrants are just south of the U.S. border, staying in makeshift shelters in Tijuana as they decide whether to stay in Mexico or apply for asylum in the U.S. Inspectors along the border are processing about 100 claims a day.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Brazen prison escape inspires dramatic television series
articles.description: In 2015, two convicted killers broke free from a maximum security prison in upstate New York with the help of a prison employee who had an affair with both of them while they were behind bars. Now their story has a become a dramatic series on Showtime.
